iati-activity.title: PLANNING OF PROJECTS
iati-activity.description: MULTISECTOR AID: PLANNING OF DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS

iati-activity.title: EGYPTIAN POLLUTION ABATEMENT PROJECT (EPAP) II
iati-activity.description: EGYPTIAN POLLUTION ABATEMENT PROJECT II (EPAP) AIMS TO DEVELOP SUSTAINABLE FINANCIAL, TECHNICAL AND INSTITUTIONAL MECHANISMS FOR POLLUTION ABATEMENT AND DECREASE THE POLLUTION LOADS IN SELECTED HOT-SPOTS AREAS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE LOCAL ENVIRONMENT CONDITI

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Community Health Awareness and NGOs Capacity Development. The programme focuses on improving the capacity of local NGOs to carry out sustainable community development work. Fidaâs main partners in the programme are Christian Practical Service Society and Dorcas Aid International but also new cooperation partners are joining the programme. Fidaâs role in the programme is to empower local NGOs through training and provision of materials. The practical development work in local communities_ however_ is done by the partners independently. Through the programme the local NGOâs are equipped with skills and know-how for carrying out sustainable development work. As their work in the local communities expands and becomes more sustainable and effective_ the local communities_ in turn_ will be empowered.

iati-activity.title: Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Cairo
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs at MFA, related to ODA. These costs cover all costs that can be counted (in full or percentually) as ODA at the Ministry for Foreign Affairs in Finland. Administrative costs at MFA from the Embassy of Finland in Cairo

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Aid for Trade; Promoting Solidarity Tourism. Aid for Trade; Promoting Solidarity Tourism_ support through New Horizon Association for Social Development.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Training Programme on Human Rights. Training programme on disseminating human rights culture and values to Egyptian Youth.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Empowerment of children with disabilities. The project has been designed towards taking efforts further to empower children with disabilities to claim their rights to education.

iati-activity.title: ICI between the National institute for Health and Welfare
iati-activity.description: The National Institute for Health and Welfare in cooperation with the Mental Health Sectretariat of Egypt are planning an ICI project for improving the quality of mental health services in Egypt. The aim of the project is to enhance rehabilitation services of mental health patients as well as improve the skills of the specialised nurses dealing with forensic psychiatry.

iati-activity.title: Evaluation of the Transition Towards a New Partnership with Egypt
iati-activity.description: Evaluation of the transition phase of the Finnish aid to Egypt.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Civic Education and Citizenship Project. To specify the meaning of civic education, its philosophy, methodology, goals and activities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Combating Violence Against Women . To reduce violence against women and children especially home violence and sexual harassment in the Giza governorate. Sawa Association seeks to empower woman and enable her to practice all rights in particular the right to physical safety, which is being violated by violent practices in different kinds of forms against her (beating â sexual harassment - abandonment of polygamy - female genital mutilation - girls deprived from education - lack of attention to issue official documents for women).

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Administrative costs

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Will be reported by the Embassy.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: The street girls and young street meothers will participate in a vocational training programme that will enable them to learn a skill that will help them sustain themselves and their children financially when they leave the centre at the age of 23 or when they return to their families as part of their psychological rehabilitation & economic support program. Project activities include establishing a new vocational workshop for the Hand-Drawn Pieces of Cloth, conducting a training course on the vocation, producing different kinds of product that reflect their rights and needs, exhibition of products to advocate for the rights of the girls.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: The project aims to improve quality of life of cancer children patients and their families in Minia governorate by providing all types of support and assistance psychologically,socially, health-wise, and educationally. That will be achieved through implementing several interventions, which will be provided by youth voulenteers. Those voulenteers will be chosen and will be trained to support cancer children patients and their families by all means. This project will target 1000 children who suffer from cancer disease in Minia governorate inside specialized governmental treatment centers, such as : the cancer institute, the regional center of blood donation, the health insurance hospital.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: The project will implement in an area with high percentage of snails in water canals and wide distance of planted lands in the Beni Suef area. The project depends on five components. The first is the technical environmental approach: the neem extract and neem trees, quantities and the methods of treatment. The second one is developing the human recourses in villages and in concerned authorities work in that field. The third one is the community mobilization to encourage the whole community such as villagers, non-governmental authorities, and concerned authorities to face and overcome the problem. The fourth is the health education and awareness e.g. the proper use of water canals. The fifth is the follow-up and sustainability of the phase 1 villages.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: The project for Civic Education and Citizenship is concentrating in teaching children and youth the meanings of civic society and its philosophy, methodology, goals and activities. Training of children and youth takes place in both preparatory schools and youth centers. In practice, the project consists of various different activities, such as establishing civic education clubs, trainings for students and teachers, and summer camps.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Learning, teaching and working on handicrafts like pottery, embroidery, weaving and any other traditional handicrafts according to the availability of teachers in the association called Ebni Baladak (trans. âbuild your villageâ) in Luxor, Upper Egypt.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Supporting the local community through engagement of schools and their wider community to engender change in the local surroundings.Assuredly, there is a strong need to encourage the idea of ownership and thus citizenship within Egyptians. This project allows everyday people the chance to make tangible differences in their immediate surroundings and thus feel the immediate benefits. This project especially strives to prompt community spirit and encourage young Egyptians towards participating in local environmental projects across the country as a way of expressing their citizenship.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: A group of lawyers in the target area interested in women issues will be provided with legal skills and necessary knowledge to handle cases of violence against women before national courts to provide victims of violence of women with direct legal support. After the completion of the training courses for lawyers, a hotline will be launched in the target area to receive complaints from oppressed women to provide them with legal consultation and direct legal support if necessary.It is proposed also to create Support Groups (SGs) consisting of positive examples of women who have had experiences of violence and as well as others of who underwent serious experiences of violence.Series of seminars will be held to address problems and consequences of violence against women. The seminars will target women of the project beneficiaries and other turnouts form the target area.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: The project tackles to challenge of water management in vulnerable environmental settings such as Oasis. It targets local communities from the Dahkla Oasis who are mainly active in the agricultural sector to increase their know how on sustainable water management as well as raising awareness on household level on good practices in water usage. The project beneficiaries of this action will consist of a total of 1000 inhabitants, including small and medium scale farmers, CDA organizations, Government authorities.
iati-activity.sector: Water resources policy and administrative management

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Right to Privacy Program aims to promote and defend the right of every person to the protection of their right to personal autonomy and privacy, with a sub-thematic focus on the areas of sexual and reproductive rights. These activities will include research and monitoring, strategic litigation and legal analysis, and advocacy at the domestic and international levels.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Engaging our target communities located in the marginalized areas of Old Cairo and South Cairo, the project seeks to enhance the inclusion and participation of children and youth with disability in their local community.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Promoting solidarity tourism through the establishment of a community center that can be used as a guesthouse and a house for training farmers.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Egypt
iati-activity.description: Extension of the Advancement of the Healthy, Environmental and Social Cl. Prevention of bilharzia around Nile delta using natural methods. Vision for Environmental Activities, Training and Consultation Society

iati-activity.title: ICI project to improve the protection of the Egyptian cultural heritage
iati-activity.description: The Finnish Environment Institute is planning an ICI project with the Egyptian Supreme Council of Antiquities (SCA) in order to improve the protection of the Egyptian cultural heritage. The aim of the project is to improve SCA's capacity to use, maintain and update the Egyptian Antiquities Information System that includes valuable geographic information concerning the exact location of Egypt's historically and archaeologically significant sites. The project is based on the previous EAIS -project between Egypt and Finland in 2000-2007, during which the entire system was created.
